answer_found_by_llm: The suspicious IP address responsible for the initial access is 10.0.0.130.
The hostname of the machine targeted by the suspicious activity is "SALES-PC".
The username "ssales" was utilized in the suspicious authentication attempts.
No network share was identified in the PCAP.

Yes, the IPC$ (Inter-Process Communication) share was used by PsExec for communication purposes. This is the standard network share that PsExec uses to facilitate communication between processes on different machines. The traffic shows clear evidence of IPC$ share usage between the suspicious IP 10.0.0.130 and the target systems.
